Fed: Economy may need additional help 'fairly soon'

Federal Reserve officials recently spoke about the need to provide more help for the economy "fairly soon" if things do not significantly improve. (AP, 2:50 p.m.)
  • Analysts: Recession likely without budget accord
  • US home sales rose 2.3 percent in July

Study links older dads to autism in kids

A new study found older fathers transmit more DNA variations and mutations to children, which may lead to illnesses like autism or schizophrenia. (Bloomberg, 3:47 p.m.)
Pictures

Fresh look at the Patriots' roster

The preseason is winding down, and Bill Belichick will have to make some tough decisions soon.

City Council passes redistricting plan

In a 7-6 vote, the Boston City Council today approved a plan that has come under fire for diluting the political influence of the city's minorities. (Globe, 2:50 p.m.)

$800m Springfield casino plan unveiled

The plan includes a gambling resort, entertainment complex, and housing development in downtown Springfield covering about 10 acres. (Globe, 1:01 p.m.)
  • Proposed casino sites | More on Mass. casino gambling
  • Menino objects to phasing in Suffolk Downs casino

Suffolk Downs fined $1.25m for dumping manure, pollutants in Boston Harbor

The $1.25 million fine was for discharging horse manure, urine, and pollutants into tributaries of the Boston Harbor, according to records. (Globe, 1:42 p.m.)
